Unsigned DIS Report Status : Unsigned ADMISSION DATE : 11-13-94 DISCHARGE DATE : 11-15-94 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Sinus tachycardia , moderate congestive heart failure . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : Aortic stenosis , hypertension , status post right eye surgery . CHIEF COMPLAINT / IDENTIFYING DATA : The patient is an eighty-one year old female with a history of hypertension , left ventricular hypertrophy , critical aortic stenosis after drainage of a right frontal sinus mass , and postoperative episode of tachycardia , hypoxia , and somnolence . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient has a longstanding history of hypertension , frequent low level ventricular ectopy managed on Inderal , history of aortic stenosis . Cardiac catheterization showed a valve area of .5 , a peak gradient of 60 . Cardiac output was 3.6 . There was a 30-40% right circumflex lesion , clean LAD and circumflex . The patient denied any daily angina , CHF or syncope , and was scheduled for aortic valve replacement at the Etearal Etsystems/ Hospital . In 10-94 , the patient was noted to have a right supraorbital mass and was admitted electively to the Purckecation Balpoingdelt Pabarnes- Campa Memorial Hospital for drainage of a right supraorbital mass / mucocele . Intraoperatively , the patient had cocaine packing , subcutaneous epinephrine , and about 360 mg of Xylocaine . She became tachycardic , with oxygen saturations dropping to 90% . She was obtunded for approximately fifteen minutes , but hemodynamically stable . Drain was placed in her sinus and the procedure was aborted . The patient was evaluated by the medical senior and found to be in mild congestive heart failure and was transferred to the Step Down Unit to rule out for a myocardial infarction , with gentle diuresis given her aortic stenosis . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : The past medical history is notable for 1. hypertension-the patient remains on Inderal , aortic stenosis , 3. chronic lower back pain , 4. hiatus hernia , 5. status post appendectomy , status post right ear surgery , and the right frontal ethmoid mass . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : On transfer , Inderal , 40 tid ; Clindamycin , 600 intravenously q8h. ALLERGIES : The patient has a questionable allergy to Ceclor which gives her a rash , but tolerates Amoxicillin . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On physical examination the patient had a blood pressure of 160/70 , a heart rate of 60 , respirations of 16 . She was a pale , elderly woman , sitting up with a face tent on , in no acute distress . HEENT exam was notable for a drain in the right frontal sinus . Otherwise , had some dried blood posteriorly in her throat . Neck showed delayed upstrokes , jugular venous pressure approximately 10 . Lung exam revealed rales 2/3 of the way up bilaterally . Heart was regular rate and rhythm , normal Sl and S2 , with a crescendo decrescendo murmur at the right upper sternal border going to the neck . The abdomen was benign . Extremity exam showed no edema . On neurological examination , the patient was intact . LABORATORY DATA : Labs on admission were unremarkable . Chest X-ray revealed mild to moderate congestive heart failure . The electrocardiogram showed no ischemic changes . HOSPITAL COURSE : 1. The patient was admitted to the Cardiac Step Down Unit to rule out for myocardial infarction . CPK 's were flat . The patient received mild diuresis with improvement of her respiratory function . She was continued on her beta blockers . And once she was stable from a cardiac standpoint she was transferred back to the Surgical Service at the Purckecation Balpoingdelt Pabarnes- Campa Memorial Hospital . 2. Infectious Disease . Her sinus cultures were growing Staphylococcus with sensitivities pending . The patient was continued Clindamycin and followed carefully for signs of infection .
